    Basic Usage

    atr

    The goal of atr is to wrap the AT Protocol (Authenticated Transfer Protocol) behind Bluesky. And we have actually already fulfilled this goal! The entire protocol is open and documented in so-called lexicons, from which we autogenerated R functions. These are not exported, however, since dealing with them is a bit advanced. Rather we have some nice human-generated functions with documentation and examples. Start with the Basic Usage section below to learn more.

    Installation

    You can install the development version of atr like so (pak works similar to remotes here, but it‚Äôs what the cool kids use now üòÅ):

    # install.packages("pak)
pak::pak("JBGruber/atr")

    Basic Usage(#basic-usage) 

    library(atr)

    Searching Posts

    The AT protocol defines a search function at app.bsky.feed.searchPosts, however, it is not currently active, as far as we could tell. As soon as the functionality is added by BlueSky, we will implement it here.

    Want to help?

    You can help by creating an issue requesting new features or reporting bugs. If you are a developer, we are happy to accept pull requests. It should be fairly straightforward, as all endpoints are already covered by automatically generated function. But please open an issue first, so we don‚Äôt do duplicated work.
